citation.article-title: Ferruginibacter alkalilentus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Ferruginibacter lapsinanis sp. nov., novel members of the family ‘Chitinophagaceae’ in the phylum Bacteroidetes, isolated from freshwater sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ferruginibacter lapsinanis sp. nov.
Ferruginibacter lapsinanis (lap.si′na.nis. L. n. lapsus -us gliding; L. adj. inanis void; N.L. masc. adj. void of gliding motility)
Cells grown on R2A at 30 °C for 5 days are single, short rods, 1−2 μm long and 0.3−0.5 μm wide.
Colonies are circular and convex with an entire margin, slimy, translucent, glossy, rusty in colour, and reach 1−2.2 mm in diameter after 5 days incubation.
Growth occurs at 18−30 °C and at pH 6−8 with less than 0.5 % (w/v) NaCl.
No growth on either MacConkey agar or nutrient agar (Difco).
H2S production, indole production, nitrite reduction and acetoin production from pyruvate are not observed.
Aesculin, gelatin, skim milk and urea are hydrolysed, but hydroxyethylcellulose, DNA, starch and xylan are not.
Acid is not produced from amygdalin, l-arabinose, d-mannitol, d-melibiose, l-rhamnose or d-sucrose.

Activity for arginine dihydrolase is present, but activities for lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase are not. l-Leucyl-2-naphthylamide, 2-naphthylphosphate (pH 8.5) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphate (weakly) are hydrolysed, but N-benzoyl-dl-arginine 2-naphthylamide, 2-naphthylbutyrate, l-cystyl-2-naphthylamide, N-glutarylphenylalanine 2-naphthylamide, 2-naphthyl-α-l-fucopyranoside, 2-naphthyl-α-d-glucopyranoside, o-nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside, l-naphthyl-N-acetyl-β-d-glucosaminide and l-valyl-2-naphthylamide are not.

Only citrate among the substrates tested is utilized as sole carbon source and the following compounds are not: acetate, adipate, adonitol, l-alanine, amygdalin, d-arabinose, benzoate, caprate, d-cellobiose, dextran, formate, d-fructose, l-fucose, fumarate, d-galactose, gluconate, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, d-glucose, glutarate, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, inositol, inulin, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, dl-lactate, d-lactose, d-lyxose, malate, maleate, malonate, d-maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-melibiose, oxalate, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, pyruvate, d-raffinose, d-ribose, l-rhamnose, salicin, l-serine, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, suberate, succinate, d-sucrose, tartrate, d-trehalose, tyrosine, valerate, xylitol and l-xylose.
Additional characteristics are listed in Tables 1–3 and the genus description, or described elsewhere in the text.
The type strain, HU1-HG42T (=KCTC 22305T=LMG 24324T), was isolated from freshwater sediment.
